review_title: Great kids and teachers to work with
cons: Can be dragged on but most of the time you are being put to work

review_title: No raises, zero effort to fill depleted staff by hr
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Colchester, VT
cons: Understaffed, schools wants more and more from a depleted department with zero increase in compensation for years. HR is a joke

job_title: Faculty Administrative Assistant in Colchester, VT
pros: Team players, all willing to contribute for the success of the college
cons: Pay was not great for the added work load

pros: Great entry level experience for me.
cons: There were no cons with this position.

pros: Pretty campus, very nice people, excellent health care, generous time off, tuition remission, etc. Lots of smart people who will do anything to lend a hand and a close, caring community
cons: No such thing as merit pay. Whether you do your job well or just sit at your desk for 8 hours, you're paid the same and treated the same. Ambition is perceived as negative and threatening. Management attitude is "if you want a better job, or to make more money, go find it somewhere else." People stay in the same jobs for years/decades/entire careers. Administration is short-sighted and cronyism runs deep. Major sucking up required to even attempt to move yourself forward professionally. Change happens and glacial speed.

review_title: It depends on where you work in the institution
pros: Truly caring community; incredibly student focused and supportive of student needs and growth.
cons: Good old boy network rewards cronyism instead of performance; limited opportunities for training or promotion; lack of a clear vision for the future

pros: The opportunity to work closely with students on a regular basis, the benefit of getting a master's degree at almost no cost to me.
cons: Taxable benefits, sometimes long hours-which is to be expected with this position-, not enough time in the day or week to accomplish everything I would like to.

review_title: Great place to work but insecure prospects
pros: Great collegial atmosphere, small enough to know students well.
cons: College is going through major changes and job prospects are uncertain.

pros: Close-knit community for learning job skills.
cons: Only an internship and ended after graduation.

pros: Great environment to work in with positive helpful staff
cons: Could have more student work opportunities

pros: Saint Michael's College has a Great Community
cons: You cannot eat at the dining hall for free
